"Today‚Äôs hearing is the first step in ensuring the data of American consumers is being properly protected." -Chairman @CongressmanRaja

"A security freeze locks down a consumer‚Äôs credit so that fraudulent new accounts cannot be opened in their name. It is the best tool for preventing identity theft. We want to ensure that these consumer tools are actually accessible to consumers and are being utilized."

"We also need to consider how consumers can protect themselves from the risk of identity theft.  Last year Congress passed the Economic Growth, Regulatory Relief, and Consumer Protection Act, which requires CRAs to provide consumers security freezes."

"A year and a half has passed since the #Equifax breach, and the causes of that breach have been investigated and exposed.  Moving forward, it‚Äôs our job in Congress to help prevent future data breaches, and to prevent more Americans from having their information compromised."
"Today, we look at what can be done to improve data security by consumer reporting agencies, or CRAs."
"The Subcommittee on Economic and Consumer Policy is dedicated to addressing the issues affecting American consumers and our larger economy." -Chairman @CongressmanRaja

Check it out here:  https://oversight.house.gov/news/press-releases/cummings-releases-memo-on-interview-with-doj-official-on-citizenship-question-0¬†‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/RbT5fKULJE

üö®News Alert: Chairman @RepCummings releases memo on interview with #DOJ Official on citizenship question for #2020Census. Full Memo:
 http://oversight.house.gov/news/press-releases/cummings-releases-memo-on-interview-with-doj-official-on-citizenship-question-0¬†‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/MoOoNrevni

"Now, #SecretaryRoss and I exchanged several letters last week. We accommodated some of his concerns, and he accommodated some of ours. My understanding today is that Secretary Ross will fully answer all of our questions about the census." - Chairman @RepCummings

"Unfortunately, throughout this entire process, the #TrumpAdministration has obstructed and delayed our investigation. Both the #Commerce and the #DOJ  have withheld key documents and refused to answer legitimate questions"

"So, the key question we will ask #SecretaryRoss today is what was he hiding from Congress‚Äîwhat is the real reason the #TrumpAdministration wanted to add this unconstitutional citizenship question?"

"First of all, I do not know anyone who truly believes that the #TrumpAdministration is interested in enhancing the Voting Rights Act. This Administration has done everything in its power to suppress the vote‚Äînot to help people exercise their right to vote."

"Let me address that pretext directly. #SecretaryRoss and others in the #TrumpAdministration have claimed that adding the citizenship question was necessary to obtain better data to enforce the Voting Rights Act."

"These facts are not in dispute. Two judges have already struck down the citizenship question, and they issued stinging decisions finding that #SecretaryRoss violated federal law and the United States Constitution."

"He was choreographing these efforts behind the scenes, he became impatient when his demands were not being met, and he was working directly with officials at the highest levels of the #TrumpAdministration to force this issue through, including #SteveBannon and #JeffSession"

"After #SecretaryRoss testified, new documents showed that he was engaged in a secret campaign to add the citizenship question from the very first days after he arrived at the Department of Commerce."

"We have very serious questions about whether #SecretaryRoss was truthful when he appeared before Congress last year and testified on three occasions that he added the citizenship question only because the #DOJ requested it."
"Today, we will also examine #SecretaryRoss‚Äô decision to add a new citizenship question after experts at the Census Bureau warned that it ‚Äúharms the quality of the census count.‚Äù
"The latest Census begins next year, and significant challenges have been raised by the #GAO and others about whether it will be ready."
"The Constitution requires our government to conduct a census every ten years. The Constitution also requires us to count every person."
"Today, the Committee will hear testimony from #SecretaryRoss about preparations for the #2020Census" - Chairman @RepCummings

Watch live at 10 AM as Commerce #SecretaryRoss testifies before the committee! üì∫Tune in here‚¨áÔ∏è

‚ÄúSo let me be clear. This hearing will not be the end of our work as a Committee on these issues.  We will fight to bring greater transparency to all operations of our government.‚ÄùChairman @RepCummings
‚ÄúI know there are #FOIA officers across the Executive Branch watching this hearing today, and I want to say to them that I know you need more resources and more support for the work you do.‚Äù
‚ÄúThat law made a lot of important changes, but the #TrumpAdministration is failing to fully comply with the requirements of this new law.‚Äù
The #FOIA Improvement Act is a prime example of how Members of Congress from both parties can work together to achieve positive results for the American people.‚Äù

‚ÄúFor three long years, we worked together to advance this bipartisan bill through Congress.  And then, with the help of Senator Cornyn and Senator Leahy, we got it over the finish line.  President Obama signed the FOIA Improvement Act into law in 2016.‚Äù
‚ÄúIn 2013, when I was the Ranking Member of this Committee, I worked with our Republican Chairman at the time, Representative Darrell Issa, to introduce a #FOIA reform bill.‚Äù

‚ÄúIn 1966, Congress enacted the Freedom of Information Act #FOIA so the American people could better understand the decisions being made by their government. It is critical to understanding who is influencing those decisions and how those decisions will affect their daily lives.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe Committee is holding this hearing on transparency under the Trump Administration during Sunshine Week.  #Sunshine Week is the time each year when we focus on the need for greater transparency in our government.‚Äù ‚Äì Chairman @RepCummings
Today we are continuing our #SunshineWeek by examining transparency under the #TrumpAdministration. Tune in at 10 AM for our #FOIA hearing! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a-EfSDudFpY¬†‚Ä¶

"Let‚Äôs be clear, there is no question that exposure to asbestos is hazardous to human health."
üì∫ Watch @CongressmanRaja's opening statement from the first Subcommittee on Economic and Consumer Policy hearing! pic.twitter.com/veJt4doNZW

"Today‚Äôs hearing is just our first step in protecting consumers from potentially carcinogenic products.
The American people deserve nothing less." - @CongressmanRaja
"The average adult uses nine personal care products daily.  Consumers use these products trusting that they are safe and will not harm themselves or their families."
"Because a loophole in the statute that empowers the #FDA to regulate personal care products and cosmetics does not allow the #FDA to require necessary recalls."

"Yet, the #FDA cannot order any manufacturer to recall personal care products that potentially contain asbestos.
Why?"
"Let‚Äôs be clear, there is no question that exposure to asbestos is hazardous to human health.  And geologists know that asbestos can be found in rock formations that also contain talc."
"And separately, the Food and Drug Administration recently issued health advisories regarding cosmetics marketed to children containing asbestos."

"Why is this issue important right now? First, recent reports claim that Johnson&Johnson, a maker of personal care products, was aware for decades that its talc products sometimes contained asbestos, a carcinogenic mineral that has killed thousands of miners and shipyard workers"

"We will do this, first and foremost,by asking tough questions and following the facts. Today, our focus is on a group of widely-used personal care consumer products that contain talc, a mineral that manufacturers put in baby powder for infants, make-up, and body care for people"

"The Subcommittee on Economic and Consumer Policy was created to focus attention on the pocketbook issues that matter most to Americans:  economic opportunity and fairness, consumer health and safety, and the overall quality of life." -@CongressmanRaja

"When you respond, you have a choice to make. You can either buckle down and work with us, or you can continue to waste precious time and allow this crisis to worsen.  It‚Äôs up to you." - Chairman @RepCummings
"Mr. Carroll, we are going to ask you tough questions today because that is our job, and frankly, we do not think you have been doing yours." - Chairman @RepCummings

"But you squandered that opportunity.Those days are lost forever. In fact, if today‚Äôs hearing lasts just two hours, 15 more people will die while you are sitting here explaining why you had no strategy for the past two years‚Äîand still don‚Äôt really have one today."- @RepCummings
"You could have been focused on complying with the law that Congress passed and on saving the lives of tens of thousands of your fellow Americans." - Chairman @RepCummings
"That was an absolute waste of everybody‚Äôs time. All the while, you could have been focused on developing a real strategy‚Äîwith concrete goals and measurable outcomes " - Chairman @RepCummings

"Mr. Carroll, I have to tell you‚ÄîI believe your priorities are misplaced.  Think about all those days and weeks and months you spent trying to squirm out of today‚Äôs hearing, or delay it, or fight about who is on which panel. " - Chairman @RepCummings
"There was no sense of urgency.  There was no sense of passion or purpose!" - Chairman @RepCummings

"Let that sink in for a moment.  For two years‚Äîmore than half of President Trump‚Äôs term‚Äîthe White House had no national drug control strategy.  All while tens of thousands of people were dying and the crisis was escalating every single day." - Chairman @RepCummings
"However, in all of 2017, the Trump Administration failed to meet this most basic statutory requirement.  In 2018, it was no different. NO strategy was issued." - Chairman @RepCummings

"There is both a leadership vacuum and a competence vacuum at the head of #ONDCP. Under federal law, one of the most basic and important jobs #ONDCP has is to issue a national drug control strategy." - Chairman @RepCummings

"I believe today‚Äôs hearing is one of the most critical hearings we will hold this entire Congress. In 2017, more than 70,000 people DIED  from #drug overdoses in our country." - Chairman @RepCummings
